content.raw:
I decided to go over this whole model and redo it with ERB. I noticed that the door, which is a rectangular prism of dimensions 0.9x0.04x2 meters, and the handle juts out in the xy axis. The door link inertial block should have no ixy, ixz, iyz components. However, it looks like ixy=0.0004...

    <link name="door">
      <pose>-0.0 0.000 2.040 3.14159 0 1.57</pose>
      <inertial>
        <mass>41.3256</mass>
        <pose>0.4569 0.0349 1.016 0 0 0</pose>
        <inertia>
          <ixx>14.2053</ixx>
          <ixy>0.0004</ixy>
          <ixz>0.0000</ixz>
          <iyy>17.1997</iyy>
          <iyz>0.0000</iyz>
          <izz>3.0298</izz>
        </inertia>
...

I think this may have been a hack by the previous author to get around the lack of inertia in the handle.

I decided to go over this whole model and redo it with ERB. I noticed that the door, which is a rectangular prism of dimensions 0.9x0.04x2 meters, and the handle juts out in the xy axis. The door link inertial block should have no ixy, ixz, iyz components. However, it looks like ixy=0.0004...

<link name="door">
  <pose>-0.0 0.000 2.040 3.14159 0 1.57</pose>
  <inertial>
    <mass>41.3256</mass>
    <pose>0.4569 0.0349 1.016 0 0 0</pose>
    <inertia>
      <ixx>14.2053</ixx>
      <ixy>0.0004</ixy>
      <ixz>0.0000</ixz>
      <iyy>17.1997</iyy>
      <iyz>0.0000</iyz>
      <izz>3.0298</izz>
    </inertia>

...

I think this may have been a hack by the previous author to get around the lack of inertia in the handle.
